subject: Re: [junit] Test glossary?
msgSnippet: Yes, but there isn t enough room in the margin to write it here. Or, yes, but it s called Google and it s not all in one place. Or, yes, but it s called
messageBody:
Yes, but there isn't enough room in the margin to write it here.

Or, yes, but it's called "Google" and it's not all in one place.

Or, yes, but it's called c2.com/cgi/wiki and there are 12000 pages.

We're writing books. Give us time. :)

So said Herr Christian Wolfgang Hujer on 4/3/2003 --------------------
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hello dear JUnit developers,


I'd like to know wethere there's a comprehensive Unit Testing Glossary out
there, explaining at least:
Dummy
Mock
Stub
Different kinds of Tests (Unit, Performance, Integration, Interaction, System,
Functional, Acceptance, Component etc. etc.)
Invariants, Preconditions, Postconditions
When to use Exceptions, when to use internal Assertions, when to use Unit
Tests.

Is there such a glossary?


Bye
- --
